channel.title: Brandon Boswell
channel.description: Recent content from Brandon Boswell's Digital Garden

item.title: If you expect there to be time and energy at the end of the day for your daily highlight you are setting yourself up for failure
item.description: For me, this means blocking time in my morning work cycle to do my daily highlight. All the other todos can wait until my afternoon block where my brain is no longer focused, and it will actually enjoy the switching. References Four Thousand Weeks
item.content:encoded:
For me, this means blocking time in my morning work cycle to do my daily highlight. All the other todos can wait until my afternoon block where my brain is no longer focused, and it will actually enjoy the switching.

References

Four Thousand Weeks

item.title: It is easier to give advice than to take it yourself
item.description: Whenever we feel the need to give advice and wonder why that person doesn’t seem to listen / act on it remember that there is advice that you likely need to hear / act on that will also be difficult.
item.content:encoded: Whenever we feel the need to give advice and wonder why that person doesn’t seem to listen / act on it remember that there is advice that you likely need to hear / act on that will also be difficult.

item.title: I currently prefer two smaller monitors to one ultrawide monitor
item.description: Productivity To be completely clear, I have not personally tried an ultrawide monitor, but I would think screensharing and moving windows around would be annoying on one.
item.content:encoded:
Productivity

To be completely clear, I have not personally tried an ultrawide monitor, but I would think screensharing and moving windows around would be annoying on one.

item.title: You can't beat the grab and go utility of a laptop
item.content:encoded: Productivity / Digital Workflow

item.title: Balancing consuming new content vs reviewing past content
Before we begin creating something new we start by mimicking
Forgetting is a Feature
item.description: If our brains could remember everything, then nothing would be important. Our brain would be an even more calamitous place than it already is. The fact that we forget things that we don’t use regularly is actually a feature to make room for the new things you will learn. It is like optimizing for Signal to Noise Ratio
item.content:encoded:
If our brains could remember everything, then nothing would be important. Our brain would be an even more calamitous place than it already is. The fact that we forget things that we don’t use regularly is actually a feature to make room for the new things you will learn.

It is like optimizing for Signal to Noise Ratio

item.title: In writing, what the author mean't is irrelevant
item.description: This is an especially challenging trap for me as someone who doesn’t find writing easy. I often find myself in a scenario where someone reads (usually my wife) something I wrote and we discuss it, only for me to find out what I meant and what I wrote were not the same. References It is public because in the discussion, it does not matter anymore what the author meant, only what is there in writing. How to Take Smart Notes
item.content:encoded:
This is an especially challenging trap for me as someone who doesn’t find writing easy. I often find myself in a scenario where someone reads (usually my wife) something I wrote and we discuss it, only for me to find out what I meant and what I wrote were not the same.

References

It is public because in the discussion, it does not matter anymore what the author meant, only what is there in writing. How to Take Smart Notes

item.title: The importance of Primary Actions
item.description: “Use constraints so that the user feels as if there is only one possible thing to do — the right thing, of course.” Constraints work by reducing alternatives for users. A well-constructed system will present users as few alternatives as possible at each step. References 7 Principles From “The Design of Everyday Things” by UI Blogger Feb, 2022 UX Planet
item.content:encoded:
“Use constraints so that the user feels as if there is only one possible thing to do — the right thing, of course.” Constraints work by reducing alternatives for users. A well-constructed system will present users as few alternatives as possible at each step.

References

7 Principles From “The Design of Everyday Things” by UI Blogger Feb, 2022 UX Planet

item.title: There is a two hour window in each day where you are most productive.
item.description: Key Times as of Spring 2022 Find your most productive time and leverage the hell out of it. For me, it’s the first few hours after waking up. This is when I schedule my creative time ( The hour before work is the “Golden Hour” for productivity. Like the last hour before sunset in photography, it’s the perfect conditions to succeed) and time to work on my Daily Highlight. I specifically, Avoid your phone for the first hour of the day to avoid Time Traps during that productive window.
item.content:encoded:
Key Times as of Spring 2022

Find your most productive time and leverage the hell out of it. For me, it’s the first few hours after waking up. This is when I schedule my creative time ( The hour before work is the “Golden Hour” for productivity. Like the last hour before sunset in photography, it’s the perfect conditions to succeed) and time to work on my Daily Highlight. I specifically, Avoid your phone for the first hour of the day to avoid Time Traps during that productive window.

item.title: Increasing your "luck"
People with repeated success increase their chances of success by taking more shots
item.description: Luck Successful People People with repeat success Increasing your visibility This has the net effect of: Increasing your “luck” Things to do: Put stuff out into the world Take more action Do more things Meet more people Go to more events Blog about your startup Produce things & publish them Get Feedback References from Ali Abdaal
item.content:encoded:
Luck Successful People People with repeat success Increasing your visibility

This has the net effect of: Increasing your “luck”

Things to do:

  • Put stuff out into the world
  • Take more action
  • Do more things
  • Meet more people
  • Go to more events
  • Blog about your startup
  • Produce things & publish them
  • Get Feedback

References

from Ali Abdaal

item.title: The hour before work is the "Golden Hour" for productivity. Like the last hour before sunset in photography, it's the perfect conditions to succeed
Key Reasons People Play Video Games
item.description: They are a temporary escape They are social They are a challenge They demonstrate constant measurable growth References Escaping video game addiction Cam Adair at TEDxBoulder
item.content:encoded:
1. They are a temporary escape
  2. They are social
  3. They are a challenge
  4. They demonstrate constant measurable growth

References

Escaping video game addiction Cam Adair at TEDxBoulder

item.title: If you are struggling with Video Game Addiction, look for ways to get what you are getting out of those video games through other sources
item.description: For me, it was about finding another challenge and a way to see constant measurable growth. A key thing that kept me from breaking the addiction earlier was the social time I got gaming with my cousin. He and I would play almost every night and that was a major portion of my social interaction. If I was going to stop gaming into the early morning hours each night, I would need to find additional ways to get that social interaction. I decided to start digital gardening and producing a YouTube channel instead. I still game, but limit it to one or two nights a week.
item.content:encoded:
For me, it was about finding another challenge and a way to see constant measurable growth. A key thing that kept me from breaking the addiction earlier was the social time I got gaming with my cousin. He and I would play almost every night and that was a major portion of my social interaction. If I was going to stop gaming into the early morning hours each night, I would need to find additional ways to get that social interaction.

I decided to start digital gardening and producing a YouTube channel instead. I still game, but limit it to one or two nights a week.

Key Reasons People Play Video Games

References

Escaping video game addiction Cam Adair at TEDxBoulder
